intro: Stichorkis aptenodytes, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, green, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. The botanical features of Stichorkis aptenodytes make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
